update.title: Refactor routes

content.raw:
A lot of these differences come with using the routes in cloudsim-grant, instead of hand crafted ones. Even if the name are not ideal (name vs id), the result is that we are going towards a more unified approach (this applies to the 401, users, name, resource and id). The image thing is different, internally image was used and machineImage seemed inconsistent.
We can wait until gz-resources is out before we merge this PR, as long as we don't add features to cloudsim-portal until then.
content.html: A lot of these differences come with using the routes in cloudsim-grant, instead of hand crafted ones. Even if the name are not ideal (name vs id), the result is that we are going towards a more unified approach (this applies to the 401, users, name, resource and id). The image thing is different, internally image was used and machineImage seemed inconsistent. We can wait until gz-resources is out before we merge this PR, as long as we don't add features to cloudsim-portal until then.

content.raw: I think its better to be explicit, especially for tests. 'user2' and user2 are the same from the point of view of the editor, but its better to check against 'user2' than the value of a variable in a test. I don't care enough to revert it, though.
content.html: I think its better to be explicit, especially for tests. 'user2' and user2 are the same from the point of view of the editor, but its better to check against 'user2' than the value of a variable in a test. I don't care enough to revert it, though.

content.raw: So is it possible for a user with write access to revoke the owner's writes to the simulator? And if so, does the owner field reflect that? Wouldn't it be better to get rid of the field completely then?
content.html: So is it possible for a user with write access to revoke the owner's writes to the simulator? And if so, does the owner field reflect that? Wouldn't it be better to get rid of the field completely then?

content.raw: Should we change the test comments?
content.html: Should we change the test comments?

content.raw: In the current implementation, terminated simulators are also returned.
content.html: In the current implementation, terminated simulators are also returned.

content.raw: I think it was an error in the initial test. I will update the comment.
content.html: I think it was an error in the initial test. I will update the comment.

content.raw: The owner field still exists, but it shouldn't be used as a feature. If anything, it is only set upon creation, so it should be called creator. The model is still peer to peer and shared resources, where access trumps ownership
content.html: The owner field still exists, but it shouldn't be used as a feature. If anything, it is only set upon creation, so it should be called creator. The model is still peer to peer and shared resources, where access trumps ownership

content.raw:
I see some interface changes here which may break a few `gz-` components:

* No more `owner` for a simulator

* No more `users` for a simulator. Instead, using `permissions`

* Attempting to delete a simulator without permission now returns a `401` instead of a `200` with success == false

* Deleting a simulator now just terminates it but doesn't remove it from the simulators list. There's no way to remove it completely.

* The unique identifier might be `id`, `name` or `resource`, depending on the API call

* When launching a simulator, use `image` instead of `machineImage`

I'm a bit worried about merging this without having the `gz-` components in place. Together with pull request #28, which was merged but not deployed, this will break the live website and we will need a lot of changes until the site is running again.
content.html:
I see some interface changes here which may break a few gz- components:

  • No more owner for a simulator

  • No more users for a simulator. Instead, using permissions

  • Attempting to delete a simulator without permission now returns a 401 instead of a 200 with success == false

  • Deleting a simulator now just terminates it but doesn't remove it from the simulators list. There's no way to remove it completely.

  • The unique identifier might be id, name or resource, depending on the API call

  • When launching a simulator, use image instead of machineImage

I'm a bit worried about merging this without having the gz- components in place. Together with pull request #28, which was merged but not deployed, this will break the live website and we will need a lot of changes until the site is running again.

content.raw: At some point a variable was changed to the hardcoded string `user2` all over one of the tests. I think it makes sense not to have it hardcoded so I reverted that in 84f52d9. Please revert that commit if the string is preferred.
content.html: At some point a variable was changed to the hardcoded string user2 all over one of the tests. I think it makes sense not to have it hardcoded so I reverted that in 84f52d9. Please revert that commit if the string is preferred.
